chapter: 1 Overview of the NCES International Data Explorer (IDE)
heading: 1.1 What is the IDE?
text: National Center Education Statistics (NCES) made easy explore analyze large-scale international education study data via International Data Explorer (IDE). IDE interactive online tool data following studies:Program International Student Assessment (PISA) (Overview)Progress International Reading Literacy Study (PIRLS) (Overview)Trends International Mathematics Science Study (TIMSS) (Overview)Program International Assessment Adult Competencies (PIAAC) (Overview)Teaching Learning International Survey (TALIS) (Overview)International Computer Information Literacy Study (ICILS) (Overview)IDE provides wide set functions. example users can:Explore student adult performance international assessmentsExplore survey questionnaire data thousands variablesFind data United States 80 foreign education systemsCreate tables, charts, mapsCalculate averages, percentages, standard deviations, percentiles, performance/proficiency levelsRun statistical tests, including gap analyses

heading: 1.2 How do I access the IDE?
text: Visit IDE home page https://nces.ed.gov/surveys/international/ide/.Select assessment survey interest start exploring. View “IDE provide?” study learn .

ISCED level 4 programs United States often form 1-year certificate programs.Level 5 – Divided levels 5A 5B, level focuses tertiary education.
